title: Office Assistant/Customer Service Rep
description:
Salary: $20-$23 per hour
**This is Required For Your Application To Be Considered**
 
We require all candidates to take a HireBus Survey (Only 5-10 minutes of your time). There are no right or wrong answers, your responses just help us better understand more about you and how you are wired. https://go.hirebus.com?co=idwwindowroofcleaning
 
Do you have a heart for serving others? Are you a go-getter and team player? If so, keep reading…
 
The team at IDW is looking for a rockstar team member to join our growing company!
 
We are the highest-rated and largest exterior cleaning company in the area, and we want you to join us as we continue to grow!
 
Just a few reasons to work for IDW:
- $240/year towards phone expenses - for use of your personal smartphone for work functions.
- $300/year Active Lifestyle Benefit - We reimburse you up to $75/quarter to cover the cost of your gym membership!
- $1000 employee referral bonus (refer unlimited employees!)
- $2,400/year toward your health insurance
- Earn 11 paid days off per year! 16 paid days off per year after your 2nd anniversary!
- 7 Paid company holidays per year
- Simple IRA retirement account (available after 90 days)
- Employer retirement contributions match up to 3% (after 2 years of employment).
- Monthly Leadership Training
- We work first shift (Normal start time of 8:00 AM and end time of 4:30 PM)
- We don’t work weekends (Your schedule is Monday – Friday)
- Family-oriented company events!
- Company Team Building events!
- We celebrate everyone’s birthday with birthday cards and free lunch!
- Year end company Christmas Gifts!
 
We believe in developing you to become the best version of yourself, both personally and professionally. We work alongside you while growing together by offering ongoing leadership development and personal growth meetings!
 
We are a 32-year-old local company that is looking for a strong Office Assistant to help our office team with the organization and running of the daily administrative operations. The ideal candidate will be a hard-working professional able to undertake a variety of office support tasks and work diligently under deadlines. This person will be comfortable working with a high degree of attention to detail and discretion as well as incorporating new and effective ways to achieve better results.
 
Responsibilities and Requirements
- Have strong organizational skills and willingly assist associates in ways that optimize procedures.
- Answer phones pleasantly, with experience in a professional manner. Must have great customer service skills!
- Responsible for accounts payables.
- Data entry in Quickbooks Online, spreadsheets, etc.
- Provide accountant & bookkeeping with needed documents as requested by COO
- Managing accounts receivables for commercial customers, including calling on past due accounts and making bank deposits.
- Will regularly act as assistant to COO
- Will follow up with all customers after service to foster WOW! Customer experiences
- Following up with customers who have open estimates.
- Scanning estimates into software and other estimate related tasks
- Update MSDS books, handbooks, training materials, assist with onboarding documents, and more.
- Learn the procedures of job scheduling/dispatching as a backup to the Dispatcher (When in charge of scheduling you will schedule clients daily and perform other tasks related to scheduling including appointment confirmation calls).
- Filing, scanning, printing weekly reports, sending out thank you cards, picking up mail at the post office, and other work as directed by the COO.
- Responding to online reviews (Google) & oversee Google Local Service page
- Making posts to our social media pages and to our Google My Business Account
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Excellent organizational and time management skills. Must be able to multitask daily tasks and handle phone calls
- Analytical abilities and aptitude in problem-solving
- Must be a quick learner and easily able to learn new software.
 
Ideal Candidates Will Also Have
- 2 years proven experience as an office assistant or administrative assistant
- Experience in Quickbooks Online, Google Workspace (G Suite), Microsoft Office Suite, Excel, and other industry software
- Working knowledge of office equipment
- Previous experience in AR/AP.
 
**This is Required For Your Application To Be Considered**
 
We require all candidates to take a HireBus Survey (Only 5-10 minutes of your time). There are no right or wrong answers, your responses just help us better understand more about you and how you are wired. Read the instructions before taking it! ** IMPORTANT NOTE: Under "role", please select Customer Service.**

title: Financial Analyst I
description:
About FedEx Supply Chain
FedEx Supply Chain, a subsidiary of FedEx Corp. (NYSE: FDX), is a leader in the third-party logistics industry offering a diverse service portfolio that enables commerce for businesses. With a proven track record of innovation and operational excellence, FedEx Supply Chain takes a consultative approach to optimize logistics processes, implement innovative technology and drive continuous improvement. By leveraging best practices and the world-renowned FedEx network, FedEx Supply Chain delivers leading solutions that provide flexibility, enable scalability and improve cost-effectiveness for customers. Through more than 11,000 employees, 130 operations and 35 million square feet of warehouse space, FedEx Supply Chain manages nearly 150 million packages and processes 358 million returns each year. For more information, go to supplychain.fedex.com.
We Have....
- A strong FedEx brand consistently ranked among the world's most admired and trusted employers.
- A top notch leadership team with the experience needed to grow and develop your career.
- An open mind for new ideas and creative methods.
- A strong compensation and benefits package, including health, vision, dental, 401k with a strong match and much more!
General Summary....
The Financial Analyst I provides financial guidance to management through the analysis of products, operations, capital requests and strategic projects. This position assists in supporting cross-functional projects and teams by performing cost-benefit analysis.
This position will be responsible for.....
- Performs analyses regarding financial and/or operational performance on such issues as productivity, operational statistics, cost trends, and revenue trends.
- Assists with assigned projects by performing, analyzing, and tracking financial, statistical, and computer modeling techniques to support department recommendation.
- Maintains analysis models to support recommendation provided to management. 
- Performs interim forecasts and systems integrating expense, capital and budgeting.
- Coordinates and analyzes the annual business plan, capital plan and Long Range Outlook (LRO). Performs periodic updates and presents operating changes to management.
- Reviews financial plans for completeness and consistency with established objectives and priorities to include monitoring accomplishments of plans.
- Assists management in determining and defining the business impact (both operational and economic) on the operation of proposed systems, capital investments, and/or product changes. Prepares, reports on, and tracks feasibility/profitability studies related to proposed corporate programs and strategies.
- Defines data needs and creates databases used for analyses by establishing links and interfaces between various databases of company and corporate-wide computer based information and reporting systems.
- Perform other duties as assigned.
You might be a great fit if....
Education/Experience
- Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Economics, Business or related field preferred and 0-2 years of relevant experience.
- In lieu of degree, high school diploma or GED and 2+ years of relevant experience.
- Knowledge of financial analysis applying common financial metrics and methodologies including Return on Investment (ROI), Net Present Value (NPV) and allocation of fixed/variable methodologies.
- Ability to analyze, review and make recommendations.
- Proficient with Microsoft Office applications.
- Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
- Customer service driven.
- Strong team player.
Physical/Cognitive Requirements
With or without accommodation:
- Ability to follow policies and procedures.
- Ability to read, write and interpret information.
- Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide. 
- Ability to use hands to finger, handle, or feel.
- Ability to sit/walk/stand for up to 8 hours per day. 
- Must possess visual acuity, i.e., close, distance, and color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.
ADA - FedEx Supply Chain will make reasonable accommodations in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. Reasonable accommodations are available for qualified individuals with disabilities throughout the subsequent application process.
FedEx Logistics, Inc. and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The FedEx Logistics companies are committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in its application procedures, hiring, and other terms and conditions of employment. To request a reasonable accommodation, please contact Fxl.talentacquisition@fedex.com.
Job ID: 51150
Schedule: Full-time

title: Customer Care Specialist - Lima
description:
Customer Care Specialist
Imagine having the opportunity to create a meaningful employment experience, one that meets your career goals and your desire to do socially responsible work.
Girl Scouts of Western Ohio
 is shaping the future of girl leadership! Our core strengths are rooted in our agile teams, our innovation and our belief that learning never stops. Joining Girl Scouts means you will be part of an inclusive team-centric organization where the girls and communities we serve are our top priority. Working at Girl Scouts of Western Ohio allows you to build a meaningful career while you grow personally and professionally! If you would like to empower girls to make the world a better place - you belong at Girl Scouts! Join the movement!
Your duties as the Customer Care Specialist will include:
- Provide quality customer service, managing and responding professionally to all inquiries, including email, walk-in, and phone customers.
- Provide telephone support on the customer care help desk.
- Answer inquiries by clarifying desired information, researching, locating, and delivering findings. 
- Maintain documentation by entering information accurately and quickly.
- Enhance the organization’s reputation and brand identity by providing a positive customer experience for all those contacted by email, phone, or in person.
- Providing support to business services staff
- Maintaining a customer-centric environment in public areas of council facilities.
- Primary Schedule: Monday and Friday 8:30 am to 5:30 pm Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday 9:00 am - 6:00 pm. 
To be successful, you should have:
- High school diploma or GED equivalent with a minimum of one year experience in general office practices. 
- Exceptional customer service skills.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
- Excellent technical computer skills in Microsoft Office with intermediate knowledge of Word and Excel and/or introductory knowledge of Publisher desirable.
- Knowledge of Outlook and social networking.
- Ability to assist internal and external customers by researching and providing information and responding to requests promptly.
- Ability to organize materials and equipment for easy access for all audiences.
- Ability to analyze information to determine its priority and handle it appropriately.
- Valid state driver's license and functioning vehicle for work within the Girl Scouts of Western Ohio region.
Benefits:
We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by competitive compensation, depending on experience, and a generous benefits package.
Perks:
- Ability to build your skills and grow your career.
- Supportive environment for learning and development.
- Flexibility for work/life balance.
- Hybrid work schedule.
- A high-achieving and fun team.
- Casual dress code.
Plus, we work to maintain the best environment for our employees where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where everyone feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning, and culture.
Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB)
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. GSWO is an EEO/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran employer.

title: Branch Manager I
description:
Civista Bank
Description:
Position Purpose:
A Branch Manager (BM) operates as a business leader and is responsible for coaching and building your team. In this role, you will inspire, model and motivate service through staff coaching and training to achieve an exceptional customer experience. The BM fosters a motivated, diverse team environment; by setting employees up for success, promoting objectives for the branch and for each employee. The BM also maintains and develops relationships with new and existing customers and creates great partnerships within Civista and the community in which we serve. The BM demonstrates Civista Bank's mission to improve the financial lives of our employees and shareholders, to make a difference in the communities that we serve.
Key Accountabilities, Responsibilities and Expectations:
- Create and execute on an annual strategic plan through analysis and critical thinking, while adjusting to market conditions and trends to achieve monthly sales and operational goals.
- Daily leadership in team and personal/professional development through scheduled coaching, training, and performance evaluations to achieve an exceptional customer experience and exceed branch goals and team engagement; will also recommend appropriate personnel actions (if no Assistant Branch Manager at the assigned location).
- Conduct interviewing and hiring of branch team in conjunction with the Assistant Branch Manager and the Regional Manager.
- Daily leadership in developing new and maintaining existing consumer and business relationships. Collaboration with partners to expand branch and market share while growing the Civista brand.
- Building the Civista brand by utilizing financial expertise; networking; developing & maintaining COIs; participating in community events, and leading in community involvement daily weekly and monthly.
- Managing operational tasks and oversight of branch facility daily, weekly, and monthly.
- Open personal, business, and loan accounts as well as cross-selling additional products and services.
- Maintain a high level of communication and follow-up with internal and external customers.
- Nurture relationship with internal business partners by making customer referrals to appropriate department for specific information and services.
- Understand and encourage the use of technology in every day banking interactions, including teaching customers how to use technology, mobile banking, P2P, online banking etc.
Requirements:
Qualifications, Knowledge and Skills:
- Demonstrate the ability to lead, coach, motivate and develop staff.
- 4 years' experience in retail or in branch banking environment.
- Drive an exceptional customer experience.
- Supervise and coach the team to achieve sales excellence, ensure the delivery of World Class customer service.
- Maintain strong partnerships with community & civic organizations.
- Associate's or Bachelor's Degree preferred
- High School diploma or equivalent required.
Physical Requirements:
- Work involves eye strain due to the constant use of computer screens, reading of reports and so forth.
- Work involves being able to concentrate on the matter at hand, under sometimes distracting work conditions.
- Work involves lifting and moving files of up to 50 lbs.
- Work involves ability to read, hear, write, and communicate professionally both in person and via telephone.
- Work involves some travel to attend meetings, training, and so forth.
Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters
Equal Opportunity Employer EEOC M/F/D/V
This Position Description is not a complete statement of all duties and responsibilities comprising this position.
Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this position at any time.
PI236532913

title: Business Banking Officer
description:
Job Title:
 Business Banking Officer
Location:
 Bluffton, OH
Status:
 Full Time
FSLA Job Class:
 Exempt
Department:
 Commercial Loan Sales
Reports To:
 Local City President
At Citizens National Bank, we have surrounded ourselves with some of the brightest and most talented professionals in the financial service industry to form a solid and secure community banking foundation. 
Citizens National Bank has an excellent opportunity available in our Bluffton market for a Business Banking Officer. In this role you will be responsible for prospecting, originating, processing, and evaluating new business, the closing of commercial/ag loans, as well as maintaining and servicing an existing portfolio. This position will also develop robust relationships with an emphasis on commercial loans and deposits, as well as Treasury Management products and services. The Business Banking Officer also represents the bank in the local community through active participation in community affairs and participates in marketing all of the bank's products and services. 
A typical day may include the following: 
- Source and develop commercial loan requests and deposits for new and existing customers through regular outside sales calls.
- Maximize bank profitability through appropriate pricing of new loan originations, fee income, and promoting all bank products and services. 
- Analyze applicant financial status, credit, and property evaluation to determine feasibility of granting loan, or work closely with Credit Analyst for verification and recommendation. 
- Negotiate terms, structure loan financing based on risk consideration and present credits for approval to appropriate levels of authority with the bank as required. 
- Correspond with, counsel and keep individuals apprised of loan application status.
- Ensure loan agreements are complete and accurate according to policy, close loans. 
- Support the bank's relationship banking culture through on-going customer contact, quality customer service and superior product knowledge. 
- Promote favorable image of the financial institution in all business activities within the community.
- This position requires travel to outside offices/locations at times to meet with management, staff and others, however on-site presence is also necessary for regular, successful performance. 
- Complies with all bank, state and federal policies, procedures and regulations.
JOB REQUIREMENTS:
- Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance or related field
ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:
- Five (5) to ten (10) years in a financial institution or loan setting is preferred
- Previous sales experience
- Basic understanding of financial institution policies and procedures.
- Must have stellar written and verbal communication skills.
- High level of professionalism
- Credit Training is required.
- Proficiency in computer software such as Word, Excel, and Outlook
- Must maintain a well-developed working knowledge of the bank's products and services, along with the applicable regulations and operating systems. 
- Must have the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines. 
WHAT'S GREAT ABOUT WORKING AT CITIZENS NATIONAL BANK?
- Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
- Company Paid Life Insurance 
- Company Paid Short Term & Long Term Disability 
- Generous Paid Time Off including Vacation, Sick, Personal, and Emergency Time
- 11 Paid Holidays
- Incentive Plan paid on a quarterly basis
- Employee Stock Ownership Plan for your retirement
- Banking Perks 
Citizens National Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer of women, minorities, protected veterans and individuals with disabilities.

title: Health, Safety, & Environmental Specialist
description:
New opportunity available for a hands on Health, Safety, & Environmental (HSE) Specialist / Engineer. This role will focus on HSE iniitiarives at industrial plant located in Wapakoneta, OH.
As a Site HSE Engineer, you will play a crucial role in leading compliance programs. You will be responsible for developing, establishing, implementing, reviewing, and revising site procedures and programs to ensure the highest standards of health, safety, and environmental practices are met. 
Oveview of Job Functions
- Develop, establish, and implement site-specific HSE procedures and programs.
- Monitor and ensure compliance with federal, state, and local regulations and industry standards.
- Conduct risk assessments and identify potential hazards, recommending corrective actions.
- Lead incident investigations and root cause analysis, implementing preventive measures.
- Develop and deliver HSE training programs to employees and contractors.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to promote a culture of safety and environmental responsibility.
- Continuously evaluate and improve HSE programs to enhance workplace safety and sustainability.
- Prepare and maintain accurate HSE reports and records.
Requirements
- Bachelor's degree in Environmental Health & Safety, Engineering, or a related field with an emphasis on industrial safety programs or equivalent.
- 2 to 5 years of related EHS experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment.
- Strong leadership skills
- Strong knowledge of federal, state, and local HSE regulations and industry best practices.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Proven ability to develop and implement effective HSE programs.
- Analytical mindset with the ability to identify and mitigate risks.
- Certification in relevant HSE fields (e.g., CSP, CIH, CHMM) a plus.
- Experience with incident investigation and root cause analysis.
- Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and HSE management software.
- Ability to travel as needed for training and site audits
HSE Specialist - Engineer (Environmental, Health and Safety) - 23-26498

title: Geologist
description:
Job Title: Project Geologist
General Statement of Duties:
The Project Geologist will be working with the CTL Geotechnical Services Dept. This position is full-time with competitive pay based on experience and education. The Project Geologist will perform services primarily associated with geotechnical and geophysical explorations and investigations. This position will include a mix of field work, laboratory work, and office work. The Project Geologist will work independently on a broad array of projects under the direction of the Department Manager. The Project Geologist is expected to be involved with client marketing, proposal preparation, and may provide direction to associates on a project-to-project basis, perform project site assessments, prepare lab and field-testing assignments and duties, review documents and test results for content and accuracy. Geophysical project preparation, field testing, data processing, and reporting may also be performed by the Project Geologist. Additional responsibilities may also include training and supervision of field/lab technicians, maintenance of quality reviews and certifications, management of equipment inventory and calibration.
Examples of Duties: 
(Any one position may not include all of the duties listed, nor do the listed examples include all that may be found in this job.)
- Interact with existing clients and create new business by providing the highest level of customer service and responsiveness including- but not limited to- providing on-site evaluation of problems and recommendations.
- Prepare Geotechnical/Geophysical reports. Interact with clients on technical aspects of the projects.
- Assist in planning and execution of subsurface investigation programs, locating test boring inspections in the field and utility coordination.
- Assist in planning and execution of geophysical surveys.
- Perform Geotechnical and Geophysical analyses.
- Work independently on broad projects under the direction of a Department Manager.
- Reviews soils laboratory test results and related documents prepared by administrative personnel.
- Ability to be reliable, punctual, team player, ability to monitor and enforce quality control standards and specifications, read blueprints, quality minded and client focused.
- Focus a different variety of project including:
- Roadways and bridges and related transportation facilities
- Water and wastewater distribution, collection and treatment facilities
- Aviation facilities
- Commercial building development
- Education facilities
- Dams, dikes, and impoundments
 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
- Strong Communication skills, both verbally and in writing.
- Ability to work with others as well as independently.
- Ability to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines and standard accepted practices.
- Experience with common geological/geotechnical software or be able to utilize software with minimal training.
- Strong leadership ability
- Self-motivated, reliable, quality minded, and detail oriented.
- Knowledge of civil and engineering principles, reporting, analysis and management of teams and projects.
- Skilled at building relationships and managing multiple projects.
- Ability to manage others, manage projects, and be a team player.
- Ability to be quality minded and client focused.
- Must have ability to manage multiple projects and remain quality focused.
- Ability to be reliable and on time.
 
Minimum Qualifications:
- G.I.T. or P.G. capability is required (to already have G.I.T. or P.G. is a plus)
- 3-5 years’ experience in preparation of geological/geotechnical recommendations, project management, and interacting with clients is required.
- Experience with common geological/geotechnical/engineering software
- Self-motivated, reliable, quality minded and detail oriented.
- Must have a valid driver license and have a proven clean driving record.
 
Education:
- Bachelor’s Degree in Geology, Geophysics, or similar discipline is required.
- Master’s Degree is a plus.
 
Physical Requirements:
- Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs. 
- Must be willing to travel and be physically able to hike 3-5 miles in rough terrain with field gear.
- Portions of work is in the field and will require candidate to stand for extended periods.
 
CTL Engineering has a full benefit program that includes:
- Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
- Short & Long Term Disability
- Paid Vacations, Sick Days & Holidays
- 401K Plan
- Employee Stock Ownership Plan
- Competitive Salary
- Bonus Program
 
Why work for CTL Engineering?
- CTL is an Employee Owned and Operated Company (ESOP)
- An Equal Opportunity Employer
- A growing company that has recently celebrated over 80 years of providing quality service to our clients.
- Opportunity for personal and professional growth and success
- Achieve satisfaction is seeing the results of your work improve safety, product performance or the favorable outcome of litigation related matters.
About CTL Engineering:
CTL Engineering is a full service consulting engineering firm, which provides environmental, geotechnical, construction administration & inspection, accident reconstruction, roofing/building envelope, and specialized testing services to the construction industry. CTL Engineering is an employee-owned, MBE company.

title: Quality Technician
description:
Description:
The position of Quality Tech will be assisting the Quality Manager in the plant location.
- Excellent attendance is a must.
- Superior time management skills and must be self-driven and self-motivated.
- Must have outstanding organizational skills and attention to detail is must.
- Ability to solve practical problems: ability to interpret verbal and written instructions.
- Multi-tasking; ability to work with various challenges and deal with a variety of situations.
- Ability to read, comprehend and interpret operating instructions, training and procedure manuals.
- Excellent communication skills; able to speak effectively to employees, managers, customers.
- Excellent listening skills; ability to provide positive and corrective feedback.
- Will be very involved in the complaint process for internal and external customers; entering, tracking, receiving complaint issues and resolutions to complaints or root cause analysis.
- Ability to perform process audits.
- Data entry.
- Management and control of documents (safety, training and quality).
- Control of non-conforming supplier defects and returns.
- Management of sorting and reworks.
- Management of weekly KPI's and/or compliances with CAR (corrective action reports).
- Responsible for PAR (Preventive Acton Reports).
- Lead Safety Committee in the DC.
- Conduct 7-minute Safety Trainers to all employees’ in the DC.
- Complete safety and incident forms.
Requirements:
- Computer literacy. Must be proficient with Microsoft Office especially Excel, Access and Powerpoint.
- High school graduate or equivalent with related college degree and/or technical courses or associate (two-year) college degree.
- Minimum of one years of experience in a related field and knowledge of LEAN manufacturing, ISO, Six Sigma preferred, OSHA or Safety related field.
Mathematical Skills:
- Able to read a tape measure with speed and accuracy.
- Able to calculate figures and amounts such as percentages, measurement, volume and rate.
- Able to apply concepts of high school math.
Reasoning Ability:
- Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
- Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Physical Demands:
- Employee is regularly required to walk and talk and hear.
- The employee is frequently required to stand; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms.
- The employee is occasionally required to sit.
- The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
- Vision requirements include: close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment:
- While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, moving mechanical parts, and fumes or airborne particles.
- The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
Performance Measurements:
The performance of the employee will be measured based on the following main factors:
- Operating Standards - meet or exceed operating standards set in the areas of quality, cost, safety, customer satisfaction and productivity.
- Personal Growth - Each year, professional goals will be developed and agreed to by the employee and supervisor.
- Employee Relations - The employee will be evaluated regarding behaviors associated with appropriate human interaction, respect and communication.
- Creativity - The employee is expected to be active in advancing the business through new and innovative ideas.

title: Knowledge Management Specialist - Relocate to Saudi Arabia
Call Center Order Entry
description:
Have you ever wanted to be an employee owner? We are looking for a Customer Care Center–Supply Representative to join our team!
This position is responsible for handling a variety of customer service calls in a prompt and courteous manner. You are the first point of contact for customers as they request supplies to continue their business operations. You will enter orders, secure an eta and verify this will meet the customer’s needs. Also, to ensure PERRY proTECH is providing exemplary customer service you will perform CSat’s on customers who have recently utilized our services.
The primary functions of this position are:
- Assist customers by phone and electronically, ensuring they are directed to the appropriate resources.
- Process supply orders upon customer request
- Process AutoShip supply orders
- Track product as requested
- Perform CSat’s daily
- Assist field staff as necessary.
- Log all customer (internal and external) interactions.
- Recognizing and escalating customer issues
- Follow up with customers and users to complete resolution of issues.
- Provide training to clients on products installed.
- Train on third party remote management tools.
Additional responsibilities:
- Support sales and admin staff as needed
- Be a backup for CCC-Service, by entering in service calls ensuring a fast response time.
- Follow standard Customer Care Center procedures.
- Analyze client needs, recognize business opportunities and influence sales volume growth.
- Communicate and interact with clients, service, sales and administrative staff in a courteous and professional manner.
- Assist on special projects assigned.
- Represent and behave, at all times, in a manner that is beneficial to PERRY proTECH and its reputation.
- Be self-motivated, flexible and take initiative.
- Work as a team player by continually learning and sharing knowledge.
- Maintain all PERRY proTECH property in proper condition and secure.
POSITON QUALIFICATIONS:
- Associates Degree or equivalent with a demonstrated successful work history.
- Customer Service
- Call Center
- Able to handle difficult or emotional customer situations.
- Able to be an active listener over the phone.
- Excellent communication skills
- Keen attention to detail and interest in problem-solving.

title: Order Fulfillment and Delivery Specialist
description:
Have you ever wanted to be an Employee Owner? We are looking for a motivated Order Fulfillment Specialist to join our team!
As the Order Fulfillment and Delivery Specialist, you will help ensure client satisfaction by efficiently picking and assembling systems for order fulfillment. This individual will assist with receiving, physical inventory, an truck driving for deliveries as needed.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.
• Pick and assemble systems and setup supplies for sales order documents
• Utilize eAutomate to execute all assigned inventory transactions associated with each sales
order
• Perform pre-assembly tasks including removal of packing tape and shipping brackets, toner
installation and accessory attachment to main system
• Recognize and escalate issues when additional assistance is required
• Assist with any other warehouse logistics tasks as directed up to and including picking supply
orders, pulling part requests, cycle counts and disposition of returned equipment and
consumables
• Inspect and maintain company equipment used for daily activities including but not limited to;
forklift and crane
• Safely transport and configure equipment at client locations
• Complete basic connectivity set up such as printing, scanning and faxing
• Assist Analysts on larger and or more complex implementations
• Properly decommission replaced equipment and return for processing
• Ensure safe and timely delivery of equipment
• Communicate with the internal team regarding schedule and arrival
• Interact with customers upon arrival at customer sites
• Maintain all PERRY proTECH property in clean and orderly condition and ensure facilities are
secured
• Remain current on assigned training
GENERAL REQUIREMENTS:
- Excellent time management and organizational skills
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
- Excellent customer service skills
- Extensive product knowledge and understanding of department processes
- Strong computer skills and analytical abilities
- Self-motivated, flexible, and take initiative
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
The Order Fulfillment and Delivery Specialist works in the distribution center and is required to perform physical tasks such as lifting heavy objects and standing for long periods of time. This person may be required to drive in order to transport and install equipment and will communicate with the internal team to determine where they are needed most.
QUALIFICATIONS:
- Minimum of a High School diploma or GED
- Pass IDOT/ODOT Physical
- Clean driving record
- Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs

title: Assistant Store Manager Sally Beauty 10290
description:
Overview
Sally Beauty
Job Title: Assistant Manager
Essential Function
 Assistant Store Managers are responsible for hiring, developing and leading all store associates while ensuring optimal customer experiences, effectively overseeing all store operations, and maintaining brand standards. Develop the strategies and plans to achieve key performance indicators and financial targets through business analysis, action planning, effective communication and consistent accountability. Assistant Managers, as part of their development, support the Store Manager in all areas outlined below and are responsible for all Primary Duties when the Store Manager is not present.
Primary Duties
- 30% Brand: Provides supervision and supports the direction planning of associates daily goals and activities to deliver an exceptional client experience which maximizes sales/KPIs and drives customer loyalty in assigned stores. Emphasis placed on both the in-store selling model and Omni-channel. Ensures all brand standards are met such as merchandising, POGs, marketing, back rooms, dress code, etc. Acts as main point of contact to resolve customer issues and concerns. Analyzes store trends and can anticipate customer demands.
- 30% People: Engages, trains and develops their teams to achieve positive results. Leverages internal hiring platforms and actively recruits to build strong network of external candidates to fill positions when required. Can identify strengths as well as opportunities for each associate and can effectively address by coaching or counseling. Holds team accountable to Company policies and expectations. Maintains positive associate relations by resolving associate concerns and keeping associates informed of relevant Company information. Builds strong working relationships with Store Manager peers. Maintains consistent and timely communication with AM/DM. Fosters an environment of diversity, inclusion and belonging.
- 30% Operations: Ensures execution of all company processes through training, management, analysis and continuous improvement. Ensures all processes to support digital strategies are utilized such as Omni-channel fulfillment (SFS/SDD/BOPIS).
- Store Managers effectively manages inventory through ordering and shipment processing. Manages payroll hours to the needs of the business and schedules appropriately. Ensures all store opening and closing procedures are performed correctly. Timely and accurate follow through with Company directives, assignments projects.
- 10% Safety/Loss Prevention: Ensures the store environment is safe at all times for associates and customers; all policies and procedures are followed and enforced. Responsible for protecting company assets by ensuring all inventory and cash control procedures are being followed in store as they relate to shrink, damages, banking, etc. Analyzes and utilizes all available reporting, tools and technology. Ensures stores are compliant with all HAZMAT training and execution.
Knowledge, Skills/Abilities and Requirements
- High School Diploma or equivalent.
- Must 18 years of age or older.
- Minimum 3+ years retail sales/customer service experience preferred.
- At least 1+ year(s) prior management experience preferred.
- Ability to lead or support a team of associates to meet business objectives.
- Can effectively communicate with team and management.
- Must have scheduling availability to meet the needs of the business.
- Cosmetology license desirable, but not required.
Competencies
- Passionate Learner.
- Desire to grow and learn.
Flexible Agile Adapter
- Adjusts to multiple demands and effectively responds to new circumstances and ambiguous situations.
Talent Builder
- Builds competent, diverse teams by hiring, developing, motivating and coaching talent and prepares for future success.
Effective Communicator
- Expresses information in a candid, straight forward way, creating an engaging and inviting, open environment.
Team Builder
- Develops strong partnerships and engages with all associates, at all levels, and across different functions/segments within the Company. Understands the importance of inclusion.
Customer Focused Partner
- Understands and works to meet the needs of external and internal customers.
Results Driver
- Effective at driving and delivering plans, holds self and team accountable to a high standard to deliver objectives. Lead and motivates team and demonstrates GRIT with a determination to succeed.
Strategic Thinker
- Demonstrates vision and broad perspective to drive business performance.
Big Picture Thinker
- Executes and adapts plans, follows through on commitments and keeps up with the pace of the business. Not afraid to innovate.
Problem Solver Decision Maker
- Analyzes information and objectively evaluates alternatives to make sound decisions.
Nature and Extent of Direct or Indirect Controls Exercised by the Supervisor
- Task Level High.
- Departmental/Division Level High.
- Project Level High.
- Consultative Level High.
The amount of discretion or freedom this position has
- Strict Adherence to Guidelines.
- Interprets and Adapts Guidelines.
- Develops and Implements Guidelines.
Working Conditions / Physical Requirements
- The position requires some physical exertion such as long periods of standing, walking, recurring bending, crouching, stooping, stretching, reaching, or similar activities; recurring lifting of moderately heavy items such as shipment or record boxes. The work may require specific, but common, physical characteristics and abilities such as above-average agility and dexterity. May be required to work in other stores from time to time.
- The work environment involves everyday risks or discomforts which require normal safety precautions typical of such places as offices, meeting and training rooms, retail store and residences or commercial vehicles, e.g., use of safe work practices with office equipment, avoidance of trips and falls, observance of fire regulations and traffic signals, etc. The work area is adequately lighted, heated, and ventilated.

title: Estimator
description:
About the Estimator position
We are looking for a responsible Estimator who will help us prepare accurate estimates for our projects so that we could make informed decisions that will enhance our company's profitability and growth. Your duties will include gathering information, analyzing important metrics and providing knowledge of cost and benefits that support profitable business decisions.
You should have excellent numerical skills and an analytical mindset, and also be thorough and apt in managing relationships with key persons.
Estimator responsibilities are:
- 
Review and analyze the project and its requirements
- 
Define key variables for cost and other estimates
- 
Collect first-hand information from sites, warehouses or other venues
- 
Perform research to obtain data on labor costs, materials, production times etc.
- 
Perform data analysis, forecasting and budgeting with the help of appropriate software
- 
Collect and review offers and quotes by subcontractors or vendors
- 
Analyse risk and develop estimates based on your analysis results
- 
Prepare estimate reports or bids and present them to appropriate persons, such as project managers, clients or bidding competitions
- 
Maintain relationships with key vendors, subcontractors, suppliers, engineers and others
- 
Participate in planning of schedules, manpower needs etc., providing your consultation
Estimator requirements are:
- 
5+ years' experience of working on an Estimator or other similar position
- 
Excellent knowledge of research and data analysis methods and estimation formulas
- 
Excellent knowledge of financial and project management principles
- 
Good practical experience with analytics and estimation software, such as HCSS HeavyBid
- 
Strong math and IT skills with an analytical mindset
- 
Strong organizational skills together with thoroughness and reliability
- 
Excellent communication and negotiation skills
- BSc or BA degree in engineering, construction science or other relevant area; certification of a Professional Estimator (CPE) will be a bonus
